posts.post_content:
WotC utterly failed at this card. This and [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence) were meant to be one and the same, but they changed her to be rare to make all champions the same rarity. Instead of just balancing her ability into the rare level, they just renamed it and put no effort into making her a viable card. They claimed that they were designing each of the champions with commander in mind, but she horribly fails that test as well.  
  
All the other champions are great, but I feel really let down by this one.

They claimed that they were designing each of the champions with commander in mind, but she horribly fails that test as well.

All the other champions are great, but I feel really let down by this one.

posts.post_content:
Awesome art, terrible card. If she costed less (ideally way less, with stats lowered to compensate of course (I think a 1/7 for 2WG would have been fine) or even better, if she made the tokens indestructible (which would actually save them from most board wipe, which is what actually concerns tokens), then she'd be liked more I think.   
  
As it stands, she's vastly underwhelming.

Posted By: Bluehero (4/23/2013 3:30:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
She's quite bad and worthy of the ~1.5 she's hovering at.  
  
Let's take a look at each part of the card and think about it.  
  
5GW - A seven costed creature for green is understandable, so this doesn't necessarily mean much. No points taken off for this!  
  
Elf Shaman + 5/7 - This makes no sense. An elf and a shaman both lend for smaller P/T and an awesome ability. For the high cost, I could see her being 1/5 perhaps (to stave off Mizzium Mortars). Trostani is a 4-drop that's 2/5 and has two great abilities, for comparison. So the ability would have to be good!  
  
"Prevent all damage" is where this card goes really, really wrong. This should definitely be "All tokens you control are indestructible." For a 7-drop 1/5 (as I said above), this seems at least playable, if not 'good' necessarily.  
  
Let's compare her to Avacyn, an 8-drop 8/8 with flying and vigilance and all permanents including her are indestructible. Clearly Avacyn is better in every way, but at least Emmara would have a similar fla... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content: I understand that the creation of a mtg set takes a lot of coordination, planning, and editing, but I do not understand how something so obviously terrible could have made it to print. Granted there are "bad" mtg cards, but this one is clearly a mistake. A 5/7 Elf?! No red flags went off in anyones' mind? Am I crazy to think that it would not have been that difficult to come up with a slightly better version? It didn't have to be good, but there really isn't any excuse for it to be this bad?

Posted By: The_Trendkill (4/27/2013 8:36:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ok, first off, we all know she's awful. Secondly, can we talk about how shes got a 5/7 body... I mean WHAT? How and why? Then she costs 5GW and besides her body she manages to protect tokens from burn and combat trades. Despite how nice that is, its not worth 7 mana on a creature that can be removed in other ways along with her fireproof tokens. She could've had some sweet ability that mixed in beautifully, something flavorful. She puts her ranks before her? She should be able to sac herself to make tokens indestructable or something like that. I can see her being a 5 drop 1/3 that gives tokens +1/+1 and "WWGG: creature tokens you control are indestructable and have vigilance until end of turn." I personally would've preferred something along those lines. While she's alive she helps her allies and she's willing to sac herself to give them the boost they need.

posts.post_content:
Such a waste. I can't even see mainboarding her in Limited. How sad is that?  
  
Maybe, MAYBE she's a one of in sideboards against really damage-heavy decks (like RDW or something). But beyond that? Yeeeeesh. Mechanics fail, flavor fail (HOW is she 5/7?!), explanation fail. Just... EPIC FAIL.  
  
It's just inexcusable that the almighty cycle maintenance destroyed this card. I will continue to look at the art of this and the DGM Elemental token and just shake my head. What a blatant visual reminder of one of Wizards' biggest all-time screwups.

Posted By: JRE47 (4/30/2013 6:44:18 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It what must be the sickest jokes the gods have ever pulled. I opened her in my prerelease twice, once on Saturday and again on Sunday. Dear lord, why hast thou forsaken me?  
  
I remember seeing her art spoiled 2 weeks before and thinking, Wow, she creates tokens. But then the card came out along with the story of how she got switched with [Voice of Resurgence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Voice of Resurgence) then my heart gently weeps. Has to be the worst Maze runner ever. If we are talking practical terms her protection is irrelevant by turn 7. Most of the tokens are probably dead by the time she comes into play. And its not even good protection. Like some players have already noted Prevent all damage isn't something to be proud of. If her tokens were granted Indestructibility then we are in the same ball park as the other guild champions.   
  
I am sorry but this champion should stay home. As the only other 7 mana guild champion, [Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teysa, Envoy of Ghosts) looks sexy compared to Emmara. Why did Wizar... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Blockbust (4/28/2013 5:32:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Ok, we get it, it's bad, but, it's not THAT bad is it? This card is rated lower then [Ur-Drago](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ur-Drago) it should be at least be rated as high as [Hexplate Golem](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hexplate Golem) right. I mean [Dolmen Gate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dolmen Gate) is a good effect. At least this isn't actively bad for you, it's just conditional and overpriced for virtually every format. I don't think I'd even play this in type 4.  
  
Conclusion: It's really really bad but, it's not 1 star, 1 star is something that is actively very bad for you like [Alabaster Leech](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alabaster Leech) or something that's inefficienct with downside like [Mindless Null](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindless Null).  
  
2/5
